titlestmt.titleproper: Our Keystone Families newspaper columns and indexes 1966-2001
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Our Keystone Families newspaper columns and indexes
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Schuyler Brossman (1927-1998) wrote a regular column on genealogy titled "Our Keystone Families" for two Pennsylvania newspapers, the Lebanon Daily News (1966-) and Middletown Press and Journal (1973?-1998). He began the column while working on the 200th anniversary of Altalaha Lutheran Church. The column continued for a short time after Brossman's death and was discontinued in January 2000.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains newspaper columns from 1978-2000. There are multiple sets of the columns and detailed subject and name indexes (compiled by the South Central Pennsylvania Genealogical Society) for many years. Columns prior to June 1978 are not present, although there are indexes for those years.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
